instruction: How effective was the hierarchical-partial least square-discriminant analysis (Hi-PLS-DA) classification model in optimizing polymer classification for the identification of black polymers inside a plastic waste stream using laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) technique?

The model showed excellent performances, with sensitivity and specificity values in prediction equal to 1, indicating that it was able to accurately classify the different types of black polymers (expanded polystyrene, polystyrene, polypropylene, and high-density polyethylene). The correctness of the classification was further confirmed by the application of Fourier Transform Infrared spectroscopy (FTIR) on the same samples. These results demonstrate the potential of the LIF technique combined with a machine learning approach as a sorting and quality control tool for black polymers in recycling plants.
